definition[0]: happening or done at once and without delay
example[0]: Our immediate response to the attack was sheer horror.
example[1]: They promise immediate action to help the unemployed.
example[2]: If the eyes are affected, seek immediate medical attention.
definition[1]: existing now, and needing to be dealt with quickly
example[3]: Letâ€™s try and solve the most immediate problem.
example[4]: There is an immediate danger of war.
definition[2]: happening just before or just after someone or something else
example[5]: The most immediate effect of retirement is a dramatic reduction in living standards.
example[6]: He promised that there would be no tax increases in the immediate future.
definition[3]: next to, or very near to, a particular place
example[7]: It is a thriving shopping centre for the people who live in the immediate area.
